alert.note: Alert for Athens; Meigs; Vinton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 7:01PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Meigs, southeastern Vinton and southwestern Athens Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 700 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Albany, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Heavy Rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albany, Wilkesville, Dyesville, Salem Center, Radcliffe, Harrisonville, Dexter and Carpenter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause elevated levels on small creeks and streams, and ponding of water on country roads and farmland along the banks of creeks and streams.
